etymology.interpretation: The character 燕(yàn, 'swallow') originally depicted a swallow, which is a type of bird. This straightforward pictogram visually represents the physical form of the bird itself.

examples.chinese: 春天到来时(春天到來時)，燕子归来报春(燕子歸來報春)。
examples.pinyin: Chūntiān dào lái shí(Chūntiān dào lái shí)，yànzi guī lái bào chūn(yànzi guī lái bào chūn)。
examples.english: When spring arrives, the swallows return to herald the season.

examples.chinese: 夕阳西下(夕陽西下)，燕穿梭于屋檐(燕穿梭於屋簷)。
examples.pinyin: Xīyáng xī xià(Xīyáng xī xià)，yàn chuān suō yú wūyán(yàn chuān suō yú wūyán)。
examples.english: As the sun sets in the west, swallows flit under the eaves.
